name: Scale
summary: The size of the development as compared to the immediate historic context.

name: Materials
summary: The degree to which the development is constructed in materials drawn from the historic context.

name: Conservation
summary: The degree to which pre-existing heritage is actively enhanced and restored, or damaged and destroyed.

name: Solid-to-Void Ratio
summary: Essentially the degree to which the facade is glazed.

name: Mass
summary: The way in which the scale of a building is articulated, as compared to the historic context.

name: Beauty / Execution
summary: The beauty of a development; the intrinsic quality of the architecture, and the execution of design.

name: Proportions
summary: The harmonious use of proportions in vertical and horizontal articulation, drawing upon the historic context.

name: Balance / Symmetry
summary: The degree to which symmetry is employed, and how well the composition as a whole is balanced.

name: Plot Width
summary: The apparent plot widths / vertical seperations compared to the immediate historic context

name: Relationship to Street
summary: The manner in which the development relates to the street and street-level, informed by historic precedent.

name: Roofscape
summary: The degree to which the roofscape reflects that of the historic environment.

name: Use
summary: The degree to which the use of the development reflects that of the local historic context.

name: Detailing
summary: The appropriate use of detailing to add interest to a facade.

name: Street Environment
summary: The positive contribution made to the street environment, both private and public.

name: Vertical Hierarchy
summary: The use of height and scale to express varying importance.
